Standard deviation could be lower if the process is standardized. - QI to CA: After inspection, components are assembled. Maybe a few days, but depends on assembly complexity. Standard deviation might be moderate. - CA to PT: Assembly to testing. Testing could take a few days, maybe 2-3 days. Standard deviation could be higher if testing is thorough. - PT to PK: Testing done, then packaging. Maybe 1 day. Standard, deviation low if it's a straightforward process. - PK to WS: Packaging to storage. Maybe 1 day. Standard deviation could be low. - WS to DT: Storage to distribution. This depends on how long the product is stored. Maybe 5 days on average, but could vary based on shipping schedules. - DT to AS: Distribution to after-sales support. Maybe a few weeks, but depends on customer support timelines. Standard deviation could be higher.
